result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Alberto Roman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luis Alberto Roman in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Luis Alberto Roman.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 11/7/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed.
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed.
Received and Filed. STATES WITNESS LIST
Received and Filed. STATES MOTION IN LIMINE

Defendant Luis Alberto Roman in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has been unable to reach his client. Court passes case for defense counsel to communicate with his Client. Off the record defense counsel requests a final pre-trial and jury trial. Case adjourned for a final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Luis Alberto Roman in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.

Defendant Luis Alberto Roman in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and needs an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with R.C.S. and B.R.C.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Luis Alberto Roman in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Sarah Chwaszczewski.
Per the State case will be retabbed to a DV Court.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 29 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-22-2022 @1p
